boat.name: Amanita
boat.full_description:
'Amanita' is named for a family of mushrooms, we wanted a mushroom name as she was built by Mike Hill on a derelict mushroom farm at Thakeham, W. Sussex. The build started in 2003, she was launched first in 2007 as an empty shell, to check for leaks (and so we could have a party!) and as a workable boat in 2009 (another party!), she has been a sailing building site ever since.

She is a Nick Skeates' Wylo II design, the long version. Initially the mast was stepped through and a fidded topmast was carried but this was changed to the standard, deck stepped, in a tabernacle, in 2012. Initially based in Shoreham, later moving to Chichester, she has sailed as far West as Yarmouth, I.o.W.

Summer 2015 saw 'Amanita' mixing it with the Luggers in Cornwall! The lure of the cream tea is now a constant siren song, calling us westward once more . . .
boat.short_description: Nick Skeates' 35' Wylo II design built in steel between 2003 - 2015 by Mike Hill at Thakeham, Shoreham & Prinsted in Sussex. Launched 2009 at Shoreham.
